Articles.Content:
Hey everyone,

I've been searching through the forums and can't find the information I'm looking for on this. I am having serious problems since updating to the new Beta.

The first problem I noticed was that all of my parts are now showing multiple times.

Second, I just accomplished my first lunar landings. Yesterday, I got a precision landing in the canyons, got some great science, and brought my Kerbals home. When I went to the space center and hit recover, the ship disappeared, the science was not added to my points, and both of my Kerbals were killed. They were sitting safely on the ground waiting for recovery, then just suddenly listed as lost. >:-(

So, I decided to start a new game and see if that fixed the problem. All of my parts are STILL showing multiple times. I completely reinstalled, and am having the same problems.

I figured maybe I need to download the newest version. I can't even get that! When I try to download, it says "Invalid Token."

I'm getting very frustrated with this. I was finally making progress in this, and now the new "update" has totally screwed up all of my progress and I can't even get the game to run.

I'm sorry, but if you're going to release an "update", how about warning people that the entire thing could go straight to hell if you update.

And, just to add insult to injury, I reinstall again to see a message that they are out of the office until 2015. So, let's release an "update" that crashes the game to crap, then cut customer support for two weeks. Seriously?!?!?

Hi.

Firstly how did you update your old copy? Was it via Steam? Or a store-bought zip or installer? Did you remove the old KSP installation first? All the part names changed after 0.24, which means if you updated using the patcher or by just overwriting the old game, you will end up with two of a whole bunch of parts in addition to the SP+ parts.

I'm not sure how your kerbals got killed during recovery, but I did end up with similar multi-part issues myself going from 0.24.2 to 0.25, and a complete deletion-and-reinstall fixed it. 0.90 is the latest version so if you already have that, you shouldn't need to download any more.

I can understand you're probably a bit upset about Squad deciding to leave the office over Christmas, but hopefully all is not lost and we can try and get you back up and running anyway!

Edited December 20, 2014 by technicalfool

Thanks Technicalfool.

I upgraded via the Squad Updater.

When I reinstalled, I installed to a different folder and got the same results. I uninstalled and deleted the install folders, reinstalled, and got the same results again. That's what spurred me to download a newer version (which doesn't work).

I totally understand taking Christmas off. It's just frustrating to get an update that destroys all of your progress and renders the game basically unusable right before leaving the office for a couple of weeks. I'm mostly frustrated about losing all of my progress and not being able to download an updated version.

When I update via the Squad Updater, I get this error message at the end:

rsync error: some files/attrs were not transferred (see previous errors) (code 23) at /home/lapo/package/rsync-3.0.9-1/src/rsync-3.0.9/main.c(1518) [generator=3.0.9]

rsync exited with code 23: Partial transfer due to error

I just did a completely fresh install, and updated again. The problem still persists.

Base on what you said, it probably wouldn't be a problem if I could download a recent version instead of installing from the installer I downloaded in June.

Edited December 20, 2014 by Claw
multipost

Base on what you said, it probably wouldn't be a problem if I could download a recent version instead of installing from the installer I downloaded in June.

Yeah, this. DL a fresh copy of 0.90 from the store.

The multiple parts issue is probably because the updater adds new files without deleting the old... much has changed this time around.

YMMV continuing an old save...

Yeah, this. DL a fresh copy of 0.90 from the store.

The multiple parts issue is probably because the updater adds new files without deleting the old... much has changed this time around.

YMMV continuing an old save...

From what I can see, Saturn is having a problem downloading from the KSP store. It's a problem for me to try and resolve because I'm a mere moderator: I can bug-spray forums, IRC channels and announcement comments, but there's about a snowball's chance in hell of me being let near the Store back-end, so there's very little I'm going to be able to do about store download errors other than hope to poke Rowsdower or similar about it when they get back.

I can also see that it seems to be a Linux installation, and I'm not familiar enough with the Linux version of the Squad patcher to know if that's a copy of rsync installed with the patcher, or a general copy installed in a user's home directory and compiled from source. From the "/home/lapo/package/rsync-3.0.9-1/src/rsync-3.0.9/main.c" path name, it looks like it might be. I do know rsync is up to v3.1.1 these days, whether that makes a difference is anybody's guess though.

What I've also seen is some people having to run rsync (and therefore the Squad patcher) as root to avoid an Error 23, however that was for using rsync in other things than Kerbal Space Program. Now I don't know why the Squad patcher would want root on a Linux box, and that's definitely an "at your own risk, back everything up first" option, but depending on what rsync is trying to write to, you may not have permission to do so unless running as root.

Also, before trying the above with the patcher, remove everything from GameData. Delete the Squad and NASAMission (and any mod) folders and let the patcher re-sync everything. Obviously, keep an old working copy of the game around in case that doesn't work out either.

Edited December 20, 2014 by technicalfool
